meanings.sent1: The small village began peopling as families moved in.
meanings.sent2: The explorer's journey involved peopling new lands with settlers.
meanings.sent3: The empty town square was suddenly peopling with laughter and chatter.
meanings.sent4: The once deserted island was slowly peopling with curious tourists.
meanings.sent5: The bustling city was constantly peopling with diverse cultures and traditions.

meanings.definition: The act of becoming populated with people.
meanings.sent1: The peopling of the remote valley brought new life and energy.
meanings.sent2: The peopling of the region led to the development of infrastructure.
meanings.sent3: The sudden peopling of the park surprised the local wildlife.
meanings.sent4: The gradual peopling of the neighborhood changed its dynamics.
meanings.sent5: The historic event marked the peopling of the once barren plains.
